The '[[St. Louis Cardinals]]' 2011 season' was the 130th season for the
franchise in St. Louis, Missouri, the 120th season in the National League, and
the sixth season at Busch Stadium III. The Cardinals began their season at home
against the San Diego Padres on March 31, following a 86â76 (.531) record and
second place finish in the NL Central in 2010. The team returned to postseason
play in 2011 as the Wild Card team, after finishing second in the NL Central to
the Milwaukee Brewers by six games (see below for more details). The Cardinals
beat the Philadelphia Phillies in five games in the Division Series [http://stlouis.cardinals.mlb.com/mlb/gameday/index.jsp?gid=201-
1_10_07_slnmlb_phimlb_1&mode=recap&c_id=stl Carpenter's gem sends Cardinals into
NLCS: Game 1 against Brewers on Sunday in Milwaukee], MLB.com (October 7,
2011) and the Milwaukee Brewers in six games in the National League
Championship Series. They defeated the Texas Rangers in the 2011 World Series in
seven games.
categories: 2011 Major League Baseball season|St. Louis Cardinals
